title: Royal Mail “prioritizing parcels over letters,” UK MPs claim
summary:
The UK Parliament’s Business and Trade Committee has written to Royal Mail seeking assurances over service quality and delivery performance following ongoing disruption across the country.

In a letter dated February 16 to interim CEO Alistair Cochrane, committee chair Liam Byrne said members of parliament (MPs) were concerned about “significant” service failures, including continued disruption affecting more than 100 postcodes, which Royal Mail says is due to “local issues such as high levels of sick absence, resourcing or other local factors.”

The committee said disruption had continued well beyond the Christmas peak period and highlighted concerns that Royal Mail may be prioritizing parcel deliveries over letters.

Continue reading Royal Mail “prioritizing parcels over letters,” UK MPs claim at Parcel and Postal Technology International.

title: European Commission opens investigation into PostNord Logistics capital injection
summary:
The European Commission has opened an in-depth state aid investigation into a capital injection of about €15.4m (US$18.2m) into PostNord Logistics.

The funding was provided by PostNord Group to its subsidiary PostNord Logistics. PostNord, the parent company of the group, is jointly owned by Sweden (60%) and Denmark (40%).

The Commission said the investigation will assess whether the capital injection complies with EU state aid rules. It will examine whether the funding is imputable to the Danish and Swedish states and whether it was made on market terms, in line with the market economy operator principle.

Continue reading European Commission opens investigation into PostNord Logistics capital injection at Parcel and Postal Technology International.

title: The Loadstars’ Diary: Swag, satnav, and Superbowl ads
summary:
Having just returned from Manifest in Las Vegas with a suitcase weighing 14.5kg (up from 13.3kg on the outbound trip) here is my official tier list of exhibition hall swag: 

Anything edible. Chocolate is an excellent source of sugar to keep you energised throughout the conference; I’m never saying no to a mini bag of M&Ms. 2Socks. Always useful and you can never have enough.  
Assuming it’s past 3/4pm, anything drinkable. Beers, wine, spirits… I don’t care.  
Pens. Again, always useful and bonus ...

title: Transpacific rate war looms as overcapacity increases
summary:
A transpacific rate war now appears inevitable, as shipping lines defy supply-demand dynamics by adding capacity.
Linerlytica noted in its report this week that transpacific volumes fell 7.5% year on year last month, to just over 150,000 teu, with cargo demand muted by the impact of US tariffs, coupled with the effects of front-loading that lifted volumes in Q1 25.

The big story
Three years ago, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman told an audience in India, “it’s totally hopeless to compete with us on training foundation models but you should try anyway.” Altman walked back his comments the next day.

title: Fesco eyes expansion with service from Cambodia to Russia
summary:
